title: Refactor plugins for FashionUnited-specific use cases
description: Adapt all knowledge-work plugins from generic Anthropic templates to FashionUnited-specific workflows, tools, and domain context. FashionUnited is a global B2B fashion industry platform (est. 1998) providing news, job board/recruitment services, a B2B marketplace, and company directory across 30+ markets in 9 languages. Tech stack: Elixir/Phoenix + GraphQL API, Next.js PWA, Kubernetes on GCP, BigQuery. Key tools: Vtiger CRM, Mailchimp, Plausible analytics, Social Champ. Each plugin should be customized with FashionUnited-specific terminology, workflows, tool integrations, and domain knowledge.

title: Refactor productivity plugin for FashionUnited
description: Adapt the productivity plugin for FashionUnited workflows. Integrate with Google Workspace (calendar, email), Vtiger CRM task management, GitHub Projects (Now-Next-Later roadmap), and beads issue tracking. Add FashionUnited-specific day planning around editorial deadlines, sales cycles, and multi-timezone coordination (Amsterdam HQ, global markets). Reference FashionUnited handbook conventions for meeting notes, status updates, and team communication.

title: Refactor bio-research plugin for FashionUnited
description: Evaluate whether the bio-research plugin is relevant for FashionUnited. If not applicable, consider replacing with a fashion-industry-research plugin covering: textile/material science databases, sustainability research (ESG reporting, circular fashion), fashion trend forecasting, supply chain transparency tools, and fashion industry market intelligence. Alternatively, archive this plugin if no research vertical applies.

title: Refactor cowork-plugin-management plugin for FashionUnited
description: Adapt the cowork-plugin-management plugin for FashionUnited organizational context. Update MCP server configurations to reference FashionUnited tool stack (Vtiger, Mailchimp, BigQuery, Plausible, etc.). Add templates for creating FashionUnited-specific custom plugins. Include guidance on connecting to the Elixir/Phoenix GraphQL API and configuring fashion industry domain knowledge.

title: Update README and paths for FashionUnited fork
description: Update the top-level README.md, marketplace.json, and all references to reflect this is the FashionUnited fork of the Anthropic knowledge-work-plugins repo. Update ownership/attribution, repository URLs, plugin descriptions to reference FashionUnited context, and any paths or links that point to the original Anthropic repo. Keep Apache 2.0 license attribution intact.

title: Review 'Making them yours' checklist and write improvement report
description: After all other refactoring tasks are complete, review the 'Making them yours' section in the top-level README.md. Analyse whether all customization steps were followed correctly across all plugins. Write a markdown file with improvement points, gaps, and any remaining work needed to fully adapt the plugins for FashionUnited.

title: Refactor sales plugin for FashionUnited
description: Adapt the sales plugin for FashionUnited commercial team workflows. Integrate with Vtiger CRM for pipeline management, TOP 200 fashion brand account strategy, and job posting/advertising sales. Customize call prep for fashion industry clients (brands, retailers, trade fairs, federations). Add workflows for employer branding upsells, banner/advertorial campaigns, and the B2B subscription model. Include FashionUnited pricing structures and commercial KPIs (500k+ yearly targets for Key Account Managers).

title: Refactor customer-support plugin for FashionUnited
description: Adapt the customer-support plugin for FashionUnited Customer Service team. Focus on job posting support workflows (dashboard submission, feed/scraper issues, XML integrations with ATS systems), employer branding page management, and advertising client support. Integrate with Vtiger CRM, jobs@fashionunited.com managed inbox, and the job posting dashboard. Add knowledge base content for common fashion recruitment platform issues.

title: Refactor product-management plugin for FashionUnited
description: Adapt the product-management plugin for FashionUnited product workflows. Integrate with GitHub Projects (Now-Next-Later roadmap), beads issue tracking, and the Elixir/Phoenix + GraphQL API architecture. Add FashionUnited-specific feature spec templates for the news platform, job board, B2B marketplace, and company directory. Include user research synthesis for fashion industry stakeholders (publishers, recruiters, brands, job seekers). Reference the 2025-2026 strategic initiatives (subscriptions/paywall, Store Locator, AI-first strategy).

title: Refactor marketing plugin for FashionUnited
description: Adapt the marketing plugin for FashionUnited marketing and media partnerships team. Customize for fashion industry content creation (news articles, newsletters, social media). Integrate with Mailchimp (newsletters), Social Champ (social scheduling), Plausible analytics, and Google Search Console. Add workflows for media partnerships with federations, trade fairs, and fashion schools. Include FashionUnited brand voice guidelines, visual identity standards, and editorial ethics code. Support multi-language content across 9 languages and 30+ markets.

title: Refactor legal plugin for FashionUnited
description: Adapt the legal plugin for FashionUnited legal needs. Focus on media law, advertising regulations, GDPR/privacy compliance across 30+ markets, employment law for international team, and IP/content licensing. Add contract review workflows for advertising agreements, media partnerships, and employer branding contracts. Include fashion industry-specific regulatory considerations and multi-jurisdiction compliance (EU focus, global operations).

title: Refactor finance plugin for FashionUnited
description: Adapt the finance plugin for FashionUnited finance workflows. Integrate with Vtiger CRM billing/invoicing processes managed by Finance Manager. Add workflows for advertising revenue recognition, subscription billing (B2B model), job posting invoicing, and multi-currency operations across 30+ markets. Include FashionUnited-specific chart of accounts, reporting structures, and month-end close procedures.

title: Refactor data plugin for FashionUnited
description: Adapt the data plugin for FashionUnited data and business intelligence workflows. Integrate with BigQuery data warehouse, Looker Studio dashboards, and Plausible analytics. Add SQL templates for common FashionUnited queries (job posting metrics, news traffic analytics, advertising performance, marketplace catalog data). Include workflows for Top 100 indices management, eCommerce trend reporting, and market research across fashion industry segments.

title: Refactor enterprise-search plugin for FashionUnited
description: Adapt the enterprise-search plugin for FashionUnited cross-tool search. Configure search across Google Workspace (email, docs), Vtiger CRM, GitHub repositories (api, frontend, integrations, product-database, deploy), BigQuery datasets, company handbook (about repo), and the GraphQL API. Add fashion industry-specific search contexts (brand lookup, job posting history, editorial archives, marketplace catalog search).

title: Add .gitignore and remove tracked .direnv artifacts
description: Create a root .gitignore file with entries for .direnv/, outputs/, and other generated files. Remove already-tracked .direnv artifacts from git. This was identified during code review as a blocker - generated Nix/direnv files should never be committed.

title: Remove or relocate loop.sh - violates no-code policy
description: The repo convention explicitly states 'No code â€” everything is markdown and JSON.' The loop.sh bash script (1500+ lines) at the repo root violates this policy. Either: 1) Remove loop.sh from this repo and document usage in a separate tooling repo, or 2) Document an explicit exception for build/tooling scripts. The existing bug knowledge-work-plugins-xum only addresses dependency checks but not the fundamental policy violation.

title: Fix loop.sh missing dependency checks (bc, claude, jq)
description: The Codex reviewer identified that loop.sh lacks prerequisite checks for bc (used in format_number/format_bytes at lines 355/366), claude CLI (invoked at line 578 without validation), and jq (used throughout for JSON parsing). With set -euo pipefail, missing any of these causes immediate script exit with an unhelpful error. Add command -v checks for bc, jq, claude, and jj near the existing beads_check() function or in a new preflight_check() function.
close_reason: Superseded by knowledge-work-plugins-sca (remove/relocate loop.sh). If loop.sh is kept with explicit policy exception, reopen this bug to address dependency checks.

description: The bio-research plugin contains 22 Python script files across multiple skills (instrument-data-to-allotrope, scvi-tools, clinical-trial-protocol, single-cell-rna-qc, nextflow-development) that violate the 'no code' policy. Either: 1) Remove the scripts and convert functionality to documented markdown instructions, 2) Relocate to a separate tooling repo, or 3) Document an explicit exception for skill-specific scientific workflow scripts.

title: Fix PROMPT_*.md references to non-existent src/* directory
description: PROMPT_build.md (line 6) and PROMPT_plan.md (line 4) reference 'src/*' for application source code, but this repo contains no src/ directory. The repo is markdown/JSON-only plugins. Update prompts to reference the actual plugin directory structure instead.
